trans-unit.source: Managing Azure SQL Database using SQL Server Management Studio
trans-unit.target: Managing Azure SQL Database using SQL Server Management Studio

trans-unit.source: You can use SQL Server Management Studio (SSMS) to administer Azure SQL Database logical servers and databases.
trans-unit.target: You can use SQL Server Management Studio (SSMS) to administer Azure SQL Database logical servers and databases.

trans-unit.source: This topic walks you through common tasks with SSMS.
trans-unit.target: This topic walks you through common tasks with SSMS.

trans-unit.source: You should already have a logical server and database created in Azure SQL Database before you begin.
trans-unit.target: You should already have a logical server and database created in Azure SQL Database before you begin.

trans-unit.source: To get started, read [Create your first Azure SQL Database](sql-database-get-started.md) and then come back.
trans-unit.target: To get started, read [Create your first Azure SQL Database](sql-database-get-started.md) and then come back.

trans-unit.source: It's recommended that you use the latest version of SSMS whenever you work with Azure SQL Database.
trans-unit.target: It's recommended that you use the latest version of SSMS whenever you work with Azure SQL Database.

trans-unit.source: Visit [Download SQL Server Management Studio](https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/mt238290.aspx) to get it.
trans-unit.target: Visit [Download SQL Server Management Studio](https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/mt238290.aspx) to get it.

trans-unit.source: Connect to a SQL Database logical server
trans-unit.target: Connect to a SQL Database logical server

trans-unit.source: Connecting to SQL Database requires that you know the server name on Azure.
trans-unit.target: Connecting to SQL Database requires that you know the server name on Azure.

trans-unit.source: You might need to sign in to the portal to get this information.
trans-unit.target: You might need to sign in to the portal to get this information.

trans-unit.source: Sign in to the [Azure Management Portal](http://manage.windowsazure.com).
trans-unit.target: Sign in to the [Azure Management Portal](http://manage.windowsazure.com).

trans-unit.source: In the left pane, click **SQL Databases**.
trans-unit.target: In the left pane, click **SQL Databases**.

trans-unit.source: On the SQL Databases home page, click **SERVERS** at the top of the page to list all of the servers associated with your subscription.
trans-unit.target: On the SQL Databases home page, click **SERVERS** at the top of the page to list all of the servers associated with your subscription.

trans-unit.source: Find the name of the server to which you want to connect and copy it to the clipboard.
trans-unit.target: Find the name of the server to which you want to connect and copy it to the clipboard.

trans-unit.source: Next, configure your SQL Database firewall to
trans-unit.target: Next, configure your SQL Database firewall to

trans-unit.source: allow connections from your local machine.
trans-unit.target: allow connections from your local machine.

trans-unit.source: You do this by adding your local machines IP address to the firewall exception list.
trans-unit.target: You do this by adding your local machines IP address to the firewall exception list.

trans-unit.source: On SQL Databases home page, click **SERVERS** and then click the server to which you want to connect.
trans-unit.target: On SQL Databases home page, click **SERVERS** and then click the server to which you want to connect.

trans-unit.source: Click **Configure** at the top of the page.
trans-unit.target: Click **Configure** at the top of the page.

trans-unit.source: Copy the IP address in CURRENT CLIENT IP ADDRESS.
trans-unit.target: Copy the IP address in CURRENT CLIENT IP ADDRESS.

trans-unit.source: In the Configure page, **Allowed IP Addresses** includes three boxes where you can specify a rule name and a range of IP addresses as starting and ending values.
trans-unit.target: In the Configure page, **Allowed IP Addresses** includes three boxes where you can specify a rule name and a range of IP addresses as starting and ending values.

trans-unit.source: For a rule name, you might enter the name of your computer.
trans-unit.target: For a rule name, you might enter the name of your computer.

trans-unit.source: For the start and end range, paste in the IP address of your computer into both boxes, and then click the checkbox that appears.
trans-unit.target: For the start and end range, paste in the IP address of your computer into both boxes, and then click the checkbox that appears.

trans-unit.source: The rule name must be unique.
trans-unit.target: The rule name must be unique.

trans-unit.source: If this is your development computer, you can enter the IP address in both the IP range start box and the IP range end box.
trans-unit.target: If this is your development computer, you can enter the IP address in both the IP range start box and the IP range end box.

trans-unit.source: Otherwise, you might need to enter a broader range of IP addresses to accommodate connections from additional computers in your organization.
trans-unit.target: Otherwise, you might need to enter a broader range of IP addresses to accommodate connections from additional computers in your organization.

trans-unit.source: Click **SAVE** at the bottom of the page.
trans-unit.target: Click **SAVE** at the bottom of the page.

trans-unit.source: **Note:** There can be up as much as a five-minute delay for changes
trans-unit.target: **Note:** There can be up as much as a five-minute delay for changes

trans-unit.source: to the firewall settings to take effect.
trans-unit.target: to the firewall settings to take effect.

trans-unit.source: You are now ready to connect to SQL Database using Management Studio.
trans-unit.target: You are now ready to connect to SQL Database using Management Studio.

trans-unit.source: On the taskbar, click **Start**, point to **All Programs**, point to
trans-unit.target: On the taskbar, click **Start**, point to **All Programs**, point to

trans-unit.source: **Microsoft SQL Server 2014**, and then click **SQL Server Management Studio**.
trans-unit.target: **Microsoft SQL Server 2014**, and then click **SQL Server Management Studio**.

trans-unit.source: In **Connect to Server**, specify the fully-qualified
trans-unit.target: In **Connect to Server**, specify the fully-qualified

trans-unit.source: server name as *serverName*.database.windows.net.
trans-unit.target: server name as *serverName*.database.windows.net.

trans-unit.source: On Azure, the server name is an autogenerated string composed of alphanumeric characters.
trans-unit.target: On Azure, the server name is an autogenerated string composed of alphanumeric characters.

trans-unit.source: Select **SQL Server Authentication**.
trans-unit.target: Select **SQL Server Authentication**.

trans-unit.source: In the **Login** box, enter the SQL Server administrator login that you
trans-unit.target: In the **Login** box, enter the SQL Server administrator login that you

trans-unit.source: specified in the portal when you created your server.
trans-unit.target: specified in the portal when you created your server.

trans-unit.source: In the **Password** box, enter the password that you specified in
trans-unit.target: In the **Password** box, enter the password that you specified in

trans-unit.source: the portal when you created your server.
trans-unit.target: the portal when you created your server.

trans-unit.source: Click **Connect** to establish the connection.
trans-unit.target: Click **Connect** to establish the connection.

trans-unit.source: SQL Server 2014 SSMS with the latest updates offers expanded support for tasks like
trans-unit.target: SQL Server 2014 SSMS with the latest updates offers expanded support for tasks like

trans-unit.source: creating and modifying Azure SQL databases.
trans-unit.target: creating and modifying Azure SQL databases.

trans-unit.source: In addition, you can also use
trans-unit.target: In addition, you can also use

trans-unit.source: Transact-SQL statements to accomplish these tasks.
trans-unit.target: Transact-SQL statements to accomplish these tasks.

trans-unit.source: The steps below
trans-unit.target: The steps below

trans-unit.source: provide examples of these statements.
trans-unit.target: provide examples of these statements.

trans-unit.source: For more information about using
trans-unit.target: For more information about using

trans-unit.source: Transact-SQL with SQL Database, including details about which commands are
trans-unit.target: Transact-SQL with SQL Database, including details about which commands are

trans-unit.source: supported, see [Transact-SQL Reference (SQL Database)](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/bb510741.aspx).
trans-unit.target: supported, see [Transact-SQL Reference (SQL Database)](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/bb510741.aspx).

trans-unit.source: Create and manage Azure SQL databases
trans-unit.target: Create and manage Azure SQL databases

trans-unit.source: While connected to the **master** database, you can create new
trans-unit.target: While connected to the **master** database, you can create new

trans-unit.source: databases on the server and modify or drop existing databases.
trans-unit.target: databases on the server and modify or drop existing databases.

trans-unit.source: The steps
trans-unit.target: The steps

trans-unit.source: below describe how to accomplish several common database management
trans-unit.target: below describe how to accomplish several common database management

trans-unit.source: tasks through Management Studio.
trans-unit.target: tasks through Management Studio.

trans-unit.source: To perform these tasks, make sure you are connected to the
trans-unit.target: To perform these tasks, make sure you are connected to the

trans-unit.source: **master** database with the server-level principal login that you
trans-unit.target: **master** database with the server-level principal login that you

trans-unit.source: created when you set up your server.
trans-unit.target: created when you set up your server.

trans-unit.source: To open a query window in Management Studio, open the Databases folder, expand the **System Databases** folder, right-click on **master**, and then click **New Query**.
trans-unit.target: To open a query window in Management Studio, open the Databases folder, expand the **System Databases** folder, right-click on **master**, and then click **New Query**.

trans-unit.source: Use the **CREATE DATABASE** statement to create a new database.
trans-unit.target: Use the **CREATE DATABASE** statement to create a new database.

trans-unit.source: For
trans-unit.target: For

trans-unit.source: more information, see [CREATE DATABASE (SQL Database)](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/dn268335.aspx).
trans-unit.target: more information, see [CREATE DATABASE (SQL Database)](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/dn268335.aspx).

trans-unit.source: The statement below creates a new database named **myTestDB** and specifies that it is a Standard S0 Edition database with a default maximum size of 250GB.
trans-unit.target: The statement below creates a new database named **myTestDB** and specifies that it is a Standard S0 Edition database with a default maximum size of 250GB.

trans-unit.source: Click **Execute** to run the query.
trans-unit.target: Click **Execute** to run the query.

trans-unit.source: Use the **ALTER DATABASE** statement to modify an existing database,
trans-unit.target: Use the **ALTER DATABASE** statement to modify an existing database,

trans-unit.source: for example if you want to change the name and edition
trans-unit.target: for example if you want to change the name and edition

trans-unit.source: of the database.
trans-unit.target: of the database.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see [ALTER DATABASE (SQL Database)](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/ms174269.aspx).
trans-unit.target: For more information, see [ALTER DATABASE (SQL Database)](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/ms174269.aspx).

trans-unit.source: The
trans-unit.target: The

trans-unit.source: statement below modifies the database you created in the previous
trans-unit.target: statement below modifies the database you created in the previous

trans-unit.source: step to change edition to Standard S1.
trans-unit.target: step to change edition to Standard S1.

trans-unit.source: Use **the DROP DATABASE** Statement to delete an existing database.
trans-unit.target: Use **the DROP DATABASE** Statement to delete an existing database.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see [DROP DATABASE (SQL Database)](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/ms178613.aspx).
trans-unit.target: For more information, see [DROP DATABASE (SQL Database)](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/ms178613.aspx).

trans-unit.source: The statement below deletes the **myTestDB** database, but don't drop it now because you will use it create logins in the next step.
trans-unit.target: The statement below deletes the **myTestDB** database, but don't drop it now because you will use it create logins in the next step.

trans-unit.source: The master database has the **sys.databases** view that you can use
trans-unit.target: The master database has the **sys.databases** view that you can use

trans-unit.source: to view details about all databases.
trans-unit.target: to view details about all databases.

trans-unit.source: To view all existing databases,
trans-unit.target: To view all existing databases,

trans-unit.source: execute the following statement:
trans-unit.target: execute the following statement:

trans-unit.source: In SQL Database, the **USE** statement is not supported for switching
trans-unit.target: In SQL Database, the **USE** statement is not supported for switching

trans-unit.source: between databases.
trans-unit.target: between databases.

trans-unit.source: Instead, you need to establish a connection
trans-unit.target: Instead, you need to establish a connection

trans-unit.source: directly to the target database.
trans-unit.target: directly to the target database.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] Many of the Transact-SQL statements that create or modify a database must be run within their own batch and cannot be grouped with other Transact-SQL statements.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] Many of the Transact-SQL statements that create or modify a database must be run within their own batch and cannot be grouped with other Transact-SQL statements.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see the statement-specific information available from the links listed above.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see the statement-specific information available from the links listed above.

trans-unit.target: The **master** database keeps track of logins and which logins have

trans-unit.target: permission to create databases or other logins.

trans-unit.target: connecting to the **master** database with the server-level principal

trans-unit.source: Monitor SQL Database using Dynamic Management Views
trans-unit.target: Monitor SQL Database using Dynamic Management Views

trans-unit.source: SQL Database supports several dynamic management views that you
trans-unit.target: SQL Database supports several dynamic management views that you

trans-unit.source: can use to monitor an individual database.
trans-unit.target: can use to monitor an individual database.

trans-unit.source: Below are a few examples of
trans-unit.target: Below are a few examples of

trans-unit.source: the type of monitor data you can retrieve through these views.
trans-unit.target: the type of monitor data you can retrieve through these views.

trans-unit.source: For
trans-unit.target: For
